articles.title: Touchstone Sands Capital Select Growth Fund Q1 2025 Commentary
articles.content: The Touchstone Sands Capital Select Growth Fund (Class A) outperformed its benchmark Index for Q1 ended March 31, 2025. Click here to read the full commentary.

articles.title: PCE data, consumer sentiment, F1 the Movie: What to Watch
articles.content: Asking for a Trend host Josh Lipton takes a look at the top stories for investors to watch on Friday, June 27. Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) data — the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge — will be released for the month of May. The final reading for June consumer sentiment will be published. Economists are expecting the reading to hold steady at 60.5. Apple Studios' (AAPL) film "F1 the Movie" will be released in theaters and IMAX (IMAX) in North America. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

articles.title: PRESS DIGEST- Financial Times - June 27
articles.content: June 27 - The following are the top stories inthe Financial Times. Reuters has not verified these stories anddoes not vouch for their accuracy. Headlines ...

articles.title: FalconEye Ventures Acquires Premium Mixed-Use Development Scottsdale Quarter
articles.content: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., June 26, 2025--FalconEye Ventures today announced it has acquired Scottsdale Quarter, a premier, 755,000-square-foot open-air mixed-use destination encompassing retail, dining, and office components, complemented by nearly 600 residential units.

articles.title: Apple Stock Gets Price-Target Cut On Mounting Challenges
articles.content: Investment bank JPMorgan on Thursday cut its price target on Apple stock, citing growing challenges for the iPhone maker.

articles.title: Apple updates the rules for its EU App Store by adding more complicated fees
articles.content: Apple on Thursday announced a series of updates to its developer policies to comply with the EU’s Digital Markets Act (DMA). The news, which was expected, arrived just in time to meet the deadline of June 26, after which the iPhone maker would risk new fines. The changes involve both how app developers can communicate […]

articles.title: Nvidia rally persists: What worries this analyst about AI trade
articles.content: Nvidia (NVDA) climbs higher, hitting fresh record highs. However, the artificial intelligence (AI) chipmaker and its "Magnificent Seven" peers have underperformed other AI-related names in the S&P 500 (^GSPC), like Palantir (PLTR), Vistra (VST), and Dell (DELL). Wall Street Horizon head of corporate event research, Christine Short, tells Market Domination host Josh Lipton, Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman, and Yahoo Finance Markets Reporter Josh Schafer that it's competition with Chinese AI companies that she worries could threaten the AI play. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

articles.title: Apple's Tariff Bump Loses Steam
articles.content: Early buyers warm up the market, then things cool off

articles.title: Apple Reworks European App Store Policy to Swerve More EU Fines
articles.content: Apple has reworked the terms and conditions for developers that use its highly lucrative App Store in the European Union in a bid to avoid racking up more fines under the EU’s digital antitrust law.

articles.title: Alibaba Just Released New AI Models for Apple. Does That Make AAPL Stock a Buy?
articles.content: Apple needs China, and Alibaba just helped unlock its AI future with the Qwen3 model. Is this the catalyst AAPL bulls were waiting for?
